reset().Description: Resets this iterator to the start of the set.

UnicodeSetIterator(android.icu.text.Unic.Description: Create an iterator over the given set.

Returns: true if there was another element in the set and this object contains the element.
next().Description: Returns the next element in the set, either a single code point or a string. If there are no more elements in the set, return false. If The order of iteration is all code points in sorted order, followed by all strings sorted order.

getString().Description: Gets the current string from the iterator. Only use after calling next(), not nextRange().

Returns: true if there was another element in the set and this object contains the element.
nextRange().Description: Returns the next element in the set, either a code point range or a string. If there are no more elements in the set, return false. If The order of iteration is all code points ranges in sorted order, followed by all strings sorted order. Ranges are disjoint and non-contiguous.

Parameters: UnicodeSet: the set to iterate over.

ClassDesc: UnicodeSetIterator iterates over the contents of a UnicodeSet. It iterates over either code points or code point ranges. After all code points or ranges have been returned, it returns the multicharacter strings of the UnicodSet, if any.
